title: Augusta County: John J. Sibert to Mary Anna Sibert, March 24, 1864
summary: Sibert writes to his sister, thanking her for clothing she has sent, discussing his further clothing needs, and reporting on a recent 11-hour, thousand-man snowball fight among the troops.
keywords: Arts/Leisure, Camp Life, Family, Women, Home Life, Medicine/Hospitals, Desertion/Leave, American Civil War
